name: Quizzical12: Trivia Quest 4U | Mixed 15 Questions | 15 Questions

questions.text: With whom would you find the following characters; Druid Getafix, Obelix, Chief Vitalstatistix and Cacofonix?
How is a facsimile transmission better known?
Where is the residence of George Banks in the film 'Mary Poppins'(1964)?
Which car manufacturer's managing director challenged designers to design a car that could carry a basket of eggs across a ploughed field without any of them breaking?
Finish the sequence of major planets in our solar system, increasing in distance away from the sun; Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, _____ , _____  , _____  and Pluto?
questions.explanation:
Saturn, Uranus, Neptune.

	Use the mnemonic, 'SUN' (Saturn, Uranus and Neptune) and you will never forget again.

questions.text: What was the first country to win the 'Football World Cup' in two successive tournaments?
Who was the first man to swim 100 metres in less than one minute?
questions.explanation:
Johnny Weissmuller.

	In 1922 at the age of 18.

questions.text: What was the nationality of the architect who created the 'Sydney Opera House'?
questions.explanation:
Danish.

	Jorn Utzon born in Copenhagen in 1918.

questions.text: Liechtenstein lies between which two countries?
What art movement is the French word for 'Rocking Horse'?
questions.explanation:
Dada.

	The name was chosen at random from a dictionary by members of the group.

questions.text: What killed the Catalan architect, Antoni Gaudi, who worked on the 'Sagrada Familia' church in Barcelona?
questions.correct: Knocked down by a trolley bus
questions.explanation: Knocked down by a trolley bus.

questions.text: Mrs. John B. Dodd led citizens in celebrating what day for the first time in Spokane, Washington in 1910?
Jesse Owens won four gold medals at the 1936 Olympics. At which event did he NOT win gold?
questions.explanation:
400 metres.

	He also won the 100 metres.

questions.text: Which country opened the first 'Youth Hostel' when a schoolteacher got caught in a thunderstorm with his hiking party and ended up sleeping in the village school?
Who was NOT a famous face on the cover of the Beatles album, 'Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band'?
questions.explanation:
Muhammad Ali.

	Boxer Sonny Liston was present.
